channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Metal Prices Mixed; Copper Slips as Demand Concerns Persist
item.description: Metal prices were mixed, with copper down and trading in a relatively narrow range since Donald Trump’s victory prompted a sell-off and aluminium up a...

item.title: Things Are Quiet in Consumer Credit. Too Quiet.
item.description: Credit-card delinquencies seem to have peaked, for now.

item.title: We Can't Give Up Paper Checks, and That's a Gold Mine for Scammers
item.description: Suspected fraudsters congregate anonymously on message boards and social media, figuring out which banks to target with altered checks.

item.title: Man Group’s trend tracking fund is having one of its worst years ever
item.description: Man Group’s AHL Trend Alternative fund is down 12.77% in the year-to-date despite the previous year’s historic stock market rally

item.title: Stock Futures Slip and Bond Yields Decline
item.description: Stock futures edged lower while overseas stocks diverged.

item.title: Wall Street Is Bullish on Car Loans Despite Rising Delinquencies
item.description: Investors are snapping up bonds tied to car loans, betting that a strong U.S. economy will keep rising delinquency rates in check.

item.title: Bond yields fall as Russia’s nuclear doctrine news triggers risk-aversion
item.description: Treasury yields fell early Tuesday as investors sought the perceived safety of sovereign bonds after the Kremlin revised its nuclear doctrine in respo...

item.title: Energy stocks are still cheap. These 13 make effective use of stock buybacks.
item.description: The most important element of corporate stock buybacks is the reduction in the share count.

item.title: Conflicts can turn you against your financial adviser. Avoid these 3 big ones.
item.description: Service, fees and performance expectations are all potential hot spots.

item.title: Class of 2025 college graduates could see more job openings — especially in these fields
